Class GameBoard

  • java.lang.Object
    • GeneralStuff
      • GameBoard

  • class GameBoard
extends GeneralStuff
    Class that holds all gameBoard objects. In the current game holds 3 different gameBoards.
    Since:
    1.8
    Version:
    07.02.2018
    Author:
    Saku Karvinen

    • Method Detail

      • setValue

        public void setValue(int x,
                     int y,
                     java.lang.String u)
        Acts as setter for board values. Will be used comparing seeIt and eBoard gameboards.
        Parameters:
        x - coordinate of given value
        y - coordinate of given value
        u - value you want to insert to gameboard.

      • getValue

        public java.lang.String getValue(int x,
                                 int y)
        Acts as a getter for gameboard values.
        Parameters:
        x - coordinate of wanted value.
        y - coordinate of wanted value
        Returns:
        the wanted value

      • placeShip

        public void placeShip(Ship k)
        Places ships one by one. Creates random coordinates where ship will be placed. Creates random boolean to check if ship will be placed vertically or horizontally. Checks if the ship fits the array, if not, creates new values. After this is done it places the ship on the array on the given spot.
        Parameters:
        k - is the ship sent to method.
